intro: Galium andrewsii subsp. intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves and stems are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance.
